com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Enum BleManager.DiscoveryListener.LifeCycle

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<BleManager.DiscoveryListener.LifeCycle>
      • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleManager.DiscoveryListener.LifeCycle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<BleManager.DiscoveryListener.LifeCycle>
    Enclosing interface:
    BleManager.DiscoveryListener

    public static enum BleManager.DiscoveryListener.LifeCycle
extends Enum<BleManager.DiscoveryListener.LifeCycle>
    Enumerates changes in the "discovered" state of a device. Used at BleManager.DiscoveryListener.DiscoveryEvent.lifeCycle().

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      DISCOVERED
      Used when a device is discovered for the first time after calling BleManager.startScan() (or its overloads) or BleManager.startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval).
      REDISCOVERED
      Used when a device is rediscovered after already being discovered at least once.
      UNDISCOVERED
      Used when a device is "undiscovered" after being discovered at least once.

    • Method Summary

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • DISCOVERED

        public static final BleManager.DiscoveryListener.LifeCycle DISCOVERED
        Used when a device is discovered for the first time after calling BleManager.startScan() (or its overloads) or BleManager.startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval).

      • REDISCOVERED

        public static final BleManager.DiscoveryListener.LifeCycle REDISCOVERED
        Used when a device is rediscovered after already being discovered at least once.

      • UNDISCOVERED

        public static final BleManager.DiscoveryListener.LifeCycle UNDISCOVERED
        Used when a device is "undiscovered" after being discovered at least once. There is no native equivalent for this callback. Undiscovery is approximated with a timeout based on the last time we discovered a device, configured by BleDeviceConfig.undiscoveryKeepAlive. This option is disabled by default. If set, you should expect that the undiscovery callback will take some amount of time to receive after an advertising device is turned off or goes out of range or what have you. It's generally not as fast as other state changes like BleDeviceState.DISCONNECTED or getting BleDeviceState.DISCOVERED in the first place.
        See Also:
        BleDeviceConfig.minScanTimeNeededForUndiscovery, BleDeviceConfig.undiscoveryKeepAlive
